required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Perspective Study of the Antiviral Efficacy and Safety of Switching to TAF Treatment in CHB Adults With Suboptimal Response (SOR) and Intolerant to Entecavir
clinical_study.official_title: A Perspective Study of the Antiviral Efficacy and Safety of Switching to TAF Treatment in CHB Adults With Suboptimal Response (SOR) or Intolerant to Entecavir

lead_sponsor.agency: The First Hospital of Jilin University

clinical_study.source: The First Hospital of Jilin University

brief_summary.textblock: This is a multicenter, single arm, open label, historical control pilot Study to the antiviral efficacy and safety of Suboptimal Responders to Entecavir Switching to TAF Treatment at week 48 (investigate the rates of complete virological response on switching to TAF in patients with Suboptimal response or ETV intolerance to standard ETV= 0.5 mg monotherapy).

primary_outcome.description: The primary efficacy endpoint is the proportion of subjects with plasma HBV DNA levels below 20 IU/ml at Week 48.

secondary_outcome.description: The proportion of subjects with plasma HBV DNA < 20 IU/mL at Weeks 24
The change from baseline in plasma HBV DNA levels at Weeks 48
The proportion of subjects with ALT normalization at Weeks 24 and 48
The proportion of subjects with HBeAg seroconversion to anti-HBe at Weeks 48
The HBV DNA maintenance rate at week 48 in ETV intolerant pts.
The proportion of subjects with HBsAg seroconversion to anti-HBs at Weeks 48
The incidence of drug resistant mutations at Weeks 48

arm_group.description: Tenofovir alafenamide (TAF) 25 mg QD, oral administration, 48 weeks；

intervention.description: Tenofovir alafenamide (TAF) 25 mg QD, oral administration, 48 weeks；

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: The First Hospital of Jilin University
